laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral conductive hearing loss, more severe on the right side with an air-bone gap (ABG) of 60 dB at 250 Hz.
Low thresholds on the right and elevated thresholds on the left.
Low-frequency ABG of 40 dB at 250 Hz and bilateral mixed hearing loss, with greater loss on the left side.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, audiogram showed no change in the air-bone gap.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral mixed hearing loss with ABG of 40 to 50 dB at 250 Hz.
Low thresholds on the left side and non-responsive thresholds on the right.
Confirmed diagnosis of bilateral SCD with a larger arcuate eminence defect on the left side.
25-dB ABG at 250 Hz, bilateral acoustic reflexes present.
Lowered thresholds on the left side and non-responsive on the right.
Left SCD and a thin but intact right superior canal.
Mixed hearing loss in the right ear, left ear showed ABG of 30 dB at 250, 500, and 1000 Hz.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, there was improvement in autophony, conductive hyperacusis, and dizziness; hearing remained stable bilaterally.

laboratory_examinations.findings: cVEMP thresholds were normal limits bilaterally postoperatively.
10-dB ABG at 250 Hz on the right side.
